poem:
**Reintroduction**  

By starlight in Ikara, creatures once thought lost,  
quolls and possums play under gum-leaf shadow,  
frisky whispers in the night, paws padding softly.  
The hills remember their steps, rhythmic like rain,  
an echo of life bottled, uncorked and poured,  
wild on the earth, beneath a delicate constellation.
prompt: You are the poet Simon Armitage. You woke up this morning feeling creative. Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
